name: pump-cli
author: Evan Prodromou <evan@e14n.com>
description: Command-line tools for interacting with the pump.io API

scripts.test: npm run lint && nyc -r lcov npm run test:vows
scripts.test:install: npm pack && npm install -g pump.io-*.tgz # npm/npm#20241
scripts.lint: npm run lint:jshint && npm run lint:jscs && npm run lint:deps
scripts.lint:deps: dependency-check package.json bin/* test/*.js > /dev/null && dependency-check --unused package.json -i dependency-check -i jscs -i jshint -i nyc -i coveralls bin/* test/*.js > /dev/null
scripts.update-docs: for doc in copyright manpage readme; do npm run update-docs:$doc; done
scripts.update-docs:copyright: for i in README.md doc/pump.1; do sed -E "s/2011-20[[:digit:]]{2}/2011-$(date +%Y)/g" $i | sponge $i; done
scripts.update-docs:manpage: for i in doc/*.1; do sed "s/^\.TH PUMP 1.*$/.TH PUMP 1 \"$(date +'%d %B %Y')\" \"$npm_package_version\"/" $i | sponge $i; done
scripts.version: npm run update-docs && git add README.md doc/
scripts.postversion:push: git push origin v$npm_package_version && git push --set-upstream origin $(git symbolic-ref --short HEAD)
